title: Learn python OOP 01
text:
Development Steps

Writing down the objects on paper
Writing a class for each object
Writing methods for each class
Calling the classes and their methods

title: Github API and functions
text:
Top 5 repos using {keyword} search

import requests
import json


def search_github_repos(keyword):
    url = (
        f"https://api.github.com/search/repositories?q={keyword}&sort=stars&order=desc"
    )
    response = requests.get(
        url,
        verify=False,
    )
    if response.status_code == 200:
        return json.loads(response.content)
    else:
        return None


repos = search_github_repos("python")
if repos is not None:
    print("Top 5 repositories sorted by stars:")
    for i, repo in enumerate(repos["items"][:5]):
        print(f"{i+1}. {repo['name']} with {repo['stargazers_count']} stars")
else:
    print("Failed to fetch repositories.")

/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.11.8/x64/lib/python3.11/site-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py:1103: InsecureRequestWarning: Unverified HTTPS request is being made to host 'api.github.com'. Adding certificate verification is strongly advised. See: https://urllib3.readthedocs.io/en/latest/advanced-usage.html#tls-warnings
  warnings.warn(


Top 5 repositories sorted by stars:
1. system-design-primer with 248497 stars
2. awesome-python with 200442 stars
3. tensorflow with 181209 stars
4. Python with 176402 stars
5. CS-Notes with 171136 stars




Top 5 repos using {keyword} search - with params

import requests
import json


def search_github_repos(keyword):
    url = "https://api.github.com/search/repositories"
    params = {"q": keyword, "sort": "stars", "order": "desc"}
    response = requests.get(
        url,
        params=params,
        verify=False,
    )
    if response.status_code == 200:
        return json.loads(response.content)
    else:
        return None


repos = search_github_repos("python")
if repos is not None:
    print("Top 5 repositories sorted by stars:")
    for i, repo in enumerate(repos["items"][:5]):
        print(f"{i+1}. {repo['name']} with {repo['stargazers_count']} stars")
else:
    print("Failed to fetch repositories.")

Top 5 repositories sorted by stars:
1. system-design-primer with 248497 stars
2. awesome-python with 200442 stars
3. tensorflow with 181209 stars
4. Python with 176402 stars
5. CS-Notes with 171136 stars

Adding certificate verification is strongly advised. See: https://urllib3.readthedocs.io/en/latest/advanced-usage.html#tls-warnings

title: 随想
text:
写代码简单, 但写好代码很难






Note




Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand. - Martin Fowler





Programmers Don’t Read Books – But You Should
https://blog.codinghorror.com/programmers-dont-read-books-but-you-should/
推荐书目:

Code Complete 2
Don’t Make Me Think
Peopleware
The Pragmatic Programmer
Facts and Fallacies of Software Engineering



编程的精髓是“创造”


单元测试很重要


狗屁下载工具
https://github.com/GopeedLab/gopeed
